newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian rupee weakens on dlr demand from east India.
newsitem.headline: Indian rupee weakens on dlr demand from east India.

text.p: The rupee weakened on large dollar demand from a state-run bank in east India to close at 35.74/75 on Wednesday against the opening 35.71/73, dealers said.
"The rupee slipped from opening levels right from the morning," a dealer at a state-run bank said. "A large state-run bank was buying dollars right through the day."
"But good supplies limited the rupee's slide," he said.

Premia on forward dollars stabilised after opening down from Tuesday's levels, dealers said. Spot-March ended Wednesday at 10.15 percent annualised against Tuesday's close of 10.50 percent, dealers said.
